column4: I'm trying to run 7.04 on a dell deminsion 3000... it's freezing after the cd boot menu screen (I have tried noapic nolapic and it still goes blank)
anyone got any ideas?
If you are sure you want to install it ( not just test the LiveCD ) you could try using the Alternate install CD
no, I need to recover some stuff of the HD (the current OS is hosed)
Might try Knoppix, do you get any errors?
nope, it get a little green matrix like stuff at the top for a sec before "loading kernel" then it goes blank
astro76: Knoppix 4 is working... does that give any insight?
Knoppix is probably the best
thanks... guess I'll keep that in my bag of tricks as well
Why do you assume nobody has?
I've searched high and low and can't find it... asked in here for several days and even less responses (today was the first day I got a response)
oddly enough there is a reference to a package that WOULD support it but that package doesn't exist
Do you know how to compile your own kernel?
I've done it in the past... but I really don't want to get away from the ubuntu kernel
I doubt that you will find an official Ubuntu kernel with reiser 4 support, and if you don't have a separate /boot it can't be a module.
I don't plan on using it for my root... it will be a mounted storage partition (raid 5)
how would I do it in a module... given I don't need /boot or / to live on the reiser4 system?
you still around?
Yes
did you get my question about how to make it work as a module?
I don't know.
